conclusion: Consider the forces acting on each body and the equilibrium conditions.
Body A, B, and C are hemispherical and placed on a rough horizontal ground.
Body A and B have masses m and 2m respectively, and body C has mass m.
The radii of A, B, and C are all R.
Coefficient of kinetic friction between A, B and the ground is mu = sqrt(3)/6.
Maximum static friction is equal to sliding friction, and gravitational acceleration is g.
Body A and B are just touching each other with no force acting between them.
Body C is placed between A and B with a smooth outer surface.
Identify the forces acting on each body.
Body A: The force of gravity mg acts downward.
Body B: The force of gravity mg acts downward.
Body C: The force of gravity mg acts downward.
Ground: The normal force F acts upward on both A and B, and the frictional force f acts downward on C.
Determine the equilibrium conditions.
Body A: The normal force F must balance the force of gravity mg.
Body B: The normal force F must balance the force of gravity mg.
Body C: The frictional force f must balance the force of gravity mg.
Calculate the normal force F.
The normal force F is the sum of the normal forces exerted by the ground on A and B.
The normal force exerted by the ground on A is mg.
The normal force exerted by the ground on B is also mg.
Therefore, the normal force F is 2mg.
Calculate the frictional force f.
The frictional force f is the force of friction between the ground and C.
